organization.name: Carpe Diem Travel
organization.description: Invite-only group travel for friends who want the fun part (connection + culture) without the painful part (planning + chaos).

faq.question: Who is this trip for?
faq.answer: Men in their late 40s to 50s (and a few partners if you’re brave/strategic) who want a low-stress, meaningful reset—great food, culture, conversation, and time together—without tour-bus vibes or forced fun.

faq.question: Can I join for only part of the trip?
faq.answer: Yes. Join in Berlin, Prague, or Vienna for any portion of the week. We’ll still like you.

faq.question: What’s included in the estimated land cost?
faq.answer: Central hotels, first-class trains between cities, daily breakfasts, several group dinners, and curated experiences (walking tour, spa, hike, and a Vienna culture night). Flights and personal spending are on you (and your self-control).

faq.question: How do I join and communicate?
faq.answer: Fill the Google Form to register interest, then all coordination happens in WhatsApp. You’ll choose your cities/dates, hotel tier (premium/value), and room preference (solo/shared).

hero.headline: An Authentic Heart-to-Heart Trip
hero.subheadline: Somewhere in my 40s I realized life is too short for “we should catch up sometime.” So… let’s actually do it—properly, in Central Europe.
hero.image_alt: Central Europe Travel - Berlin, Prague, Vienna

problem.title: Celebrate Shikhin’s 50th birthday
problem.subtitle: Come visit a few of my favorite places in Central Europe—and bond with my favorite people. Think: real conversations, great walks, memorable meals, and just enough nonsense to keep us humble.

items.title: Berlin
items.description: My favorite city—where my first love story began via a client in the early StatsLateral days. Yes, I’m counting consulting as romance. Don’t @ me.

items.title: Prague
items.description: I fell for Prague in 2015 on a solo EU trip: stunning, walkable, and somehow still a great deal—like finding a five-star vibe at a three-star price.

items.title: Vienna
items.description: Vienna is where I discovered the kind of art I actually love—and the kind I hope to pursue one day. Also: coffee so good it feels judgmental.

solution.title: What we’re doing (and why it won’t be chaotic)
solution.subtitle: A private, hosted Central Europe week designed for brotherhood, culture, and ease—aka the fun parts, minus the “who booked this?” parts.

items.title: A week that feels intentional—not rushed
items.description: Three great cities connected by relaxed trains. One anchor experience per day, plus plenty of free time (because we are not 22).

items.title: Curated comfort at a smart budget
items.description: Two hotel tiers per city (premium + value), close to each other so the group stays together even if your wallet has boundaries.

items.title: Low-friction coordination

how_it_works.title: How it works
how_it_works.subtitle: Simple, adult, and flexible—join any city for any portion of the week (yes, even if your calendar is a dumpster fire).

steps.title: Pick your dates + cities
items: Full week: depart Wed night → return Wed (Nov 18–25, 2026).
Or join in Berlin, Prague, or Vienna for a shorter portion.
You’ll receive pricing based on your cities + hotel tier (no guessing games).

steps.title: Choose your hotel tier (premium or value)
items: Each city has two hotel options in the same neighborhood (walkable to each other).
Premium: a little nicer, a little more pampering.
Value: still great—just less dramatic about it.

steps.title: Reserve your spot
steps.time: One deposit to make it real
items: Reserve with a refundable deposit (details below).
We confirm hotels + trains once we have the core group.
You’ll get a simple trip brief closer to departure (packing notes included so nobody brings a trench coat and regrets it).

features.title: What’s Included
features.subtitle: Enough structure to feel special. Enough freedom to feel like a reset. Zero “mandatory fun.”

items.title: Berlin (Mitte / City Center)
items.description: Premium: Hotel Luc, Autograph Collection. Value: Motel One Berlin–Spittelmarkt. Close enough that nobody needs a taxi diplomacy summit.

items.title: Prague (New Town / Old Town access)
items.description: Premium: BoHo Prague Hotel. Value: Pytloun Boutique Hotel Prague (Wenceslas Square). Both central, both easy.

items.title: Vienna (1st District / Innere Stadt)
items.description: Premium: Boutique Hotel am Stephansplatz. Value: Hollmann Beletage. Elegant either way—choose your level of pampering.

items.title: Central hotels (two tiers per city)
items.description: Premium + value options, close to each other, in walkable neighborhoods (because we’re not wasting the trip on commuting).

items.title: First-class trains between cities
items.description: Berlin → Prague (Sat) and Prague → Vienna (Mon). Relaxed travel that counts as part of the experience.

items.title: Daily breakfast
items.description: Start easy. No morning scramble. Coffee will be handled (Vienna takes this personally).

items.title: Berlin walking tour
items.description: A 2–3 hour guided walk for history + neighborhoods—without turning the trip into a documentary marathon.

items.title: Vabali Spa (Berlin)
items.description: Decompression time after travel. Your nervous system will send a thank-you note.

items.title: Prague nature hike
items.description: A late-morning/afternoon hike across the river for views and fresh air. Yes, it’s worth it.

items.title: 4–5 group dinners
items.description: A mix of excellent local and immigrant-run restaurants—built for long conversations and high laughter-per-minute.

items.title: Optional nights out
items.description: Bars, jazz, music, nightlife—opt-in only. Nobody is forced to “send it.”

items.title: Classical music or museum experience
items.description: Concert/opera (if available) or a museum visit—chosen for vibe, not for bragging rights.

items.title: Café culture morning
items.description: A slow Vienna breakfast/café start to close the trip well. Pastries will happen.

items.title: Join any city
items.description: Arrive in Berlin, Prague, or Vienna and travel with the group for any portion of the week.

items.title: Opt-in pace
items.description: One anchor per day plus free time—no rigid schedules, no whistles, no matching hats.
